English Sentences: For thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; The daughter of Babylon is like a threshingfloor, it is time to thresh her: yet a little while, and the time of her harvest shall come.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaappe Wolqqaama GODAI, Israa7eela Xoossai hagaadan yaagees; "Baabiloone biittai kattaa qoxxiyo audiyaa mala; guutta wodiyaappe guyyiyan, i cakettiyo wodee yaana" yaagees.

English Sentences: Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon hath devoured me, he hath crushed me, he hath made me an empty vessel, he hath swallowed me up like a dragon, he hath filled his belly with my delicates, he hath cast me out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yerusalaame asai hagaadan yaagees; "Baabiloone Kawoi Naabukadanaxoori nuna wurssidi miis; nu katamaakka mela de7iya oto mala kessiis. Demee mittiyoogaadan, a mittiis; mal77oban kunttidoogaadan, i nu aquwan ba ganjjiyaa kunttiis; yaatidi attidaagaa mucidi cuchchiis.

English Sentences: The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon, shall the inhabitant of Zion say; and my blood upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, shall Jerusalem say.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Baabiloonee nu bollinne nu asaa bolli oottido iitabai ubbai a bolli simmo. Nu suuttaa acoi Baabiloonen de7iya asaa achcho" yaagees.

English Sentences: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Behold, I will plead thy cause, and take vengeance for thee; and I will dry up her sea, and make her springs dry.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, GODAI Yerusalaame asaassi hagaadan yaagees; "Ne gishshataa taani mootettana; ne haluwaakka taani kessana. Taani Baabiloone haattaa melissana; a pulttotakka toissana.

English Sentences: And Babylon shall become heaps, a dwellingplace for dragons, an astonishment, and an hissing, without an inhabitant.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baabiloonee shuchcha doorenne worakanati de7iyo geesso gidana. Qassi a be7ida ubbai dagammananne, Poora! gaana. An issi asinne naa77antto de7enna.

English Sentences: They shall roar together like lions: they shall yell as lions' whelps.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baabiloone asai ubbai gaammodan gudees; qassi gaammo maradan daarees.

English Sentences: In their heat I will make their feasts, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etau bollai ho77iyo wode, taani etayyo ufaissiya ushshaa gibiraa giigissana; eti hegaappe uyidi, banttana balana gakkanaashin, taani eta mattoyana. Eti naa77antto denddennaadan, merinau xiskkana. Taani GODAI hagaa odais.

English Sentences: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he goats.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHukkanau efiyo dorssatudan, dorssa orggetudaaninne deeshsha orggetudan, taani eta shuhau efaana.

English Sentences: How is Sheshach taken! and how is the praise of the whole earth surprised! how is Babylon become an astonishment among the nations!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asai ubbai sabbiyo Baabiloonee ohettiis! Baabiloonee kawotettatu ubbaa giddon aiba daganttiyaabaa gididee!

English Sentences: The sea is come up upon Babylon: she is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baabiloone morkketi abbaa beetai denddiyoogaadan denddidi, kataman eellidosona.

English Sentences: Her cities are a desolation, a dry land, and a wilderness, a land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth any son of man pass thereby.
Wolaitta Sentences: A katamati kolettidi, daganttiyaabaa kiyidosona; iri bukkenna bazzo biitta, ai asinne de7enna biittanne asa na7i gidduwaara kanttenna biitta kiyidosona.

English Sentences: And I will punish Bel in Babylon, and I will bring forth out of his mouth that which he hath swallowed up: and the nations shall not flow together any more unto him: yea, the wall of Babylon shall fall.
Wolaitta Sentences: Beela giyo Baabiloone xoossaa taani qaxxayana; i mittidobaakka taani a uluwaappe kesissana. Hegaappe guyyiyan, kawotettati akko zuliyoogaa aggana; Baabiloone gimbbeekka kunddana.

English Sentences: My people, go ye out of the midst of her, and deliver ye every man his soul from the fierce anger of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta asau, a giddoppe kiyite! Intte ubbaikka GODAA hanqquwaa suuluwaappe intte huuphiyaa huuphiyaa ashshite!

English Sentences: And lest your heart faint, and ye fear for the rumour that shall be heard in the land; a rumour shall both come one year, and after that in another year shall come a rumour, and violence in the land, ruler against ruler.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biittan odettiya oduwaa siyiyo wode, hirggoppitenne yayyoppite! Laittan laittan odoi oduwaa kaalli kaallidi yaana. He wode kawoi kawuwaa bolli denddiyo makkala odoi biittan siyettana.

English Sentences: Therefore, behold, the days come, that I will do judgment upon the graven images of Babylon: and her whole land shall be confounded, and all her slain shall fall in the midst of her.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, taani Baabiloone eeqa misileta qaxxayiyo gallassati yaana. He biittai ubbaikka yeellatana; siifettidaageeti ubbai katamaa giddon kunddana.

English Sentences: Then the heaven and the earth, and all that is therein, shall sing for Babylon: for the spoilers shall come unto her from the north, saith the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Huuphessa baggappe yiya bashshiyaageetu kushiyan Baabiloonee ohettiyo gishshau, saloinne sa7ai qassi eta giddon de7iya ubbabai ililana. Taani GODAI hagaa odais.

English Sentences: As Babylon hath caused the slain of Israel to fall, so at Babylon shall fall the slain of all the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baabiloonee Israa7eela asaanne hara biittan de7iya asaa ubbaa woridoogaadan, Baabiloone asaikka haiqqanau koshshees.

English Sentences: Ye that have escaped the sword, go away, stand not still: remember the LORD afar off, and let Jerusalem come into your mind.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta asau, intte olaappe kessi ekkideta. Hegaa gishshau, biite! Hagan eqqoppite! Intte de7iyo haaho biittankka tana GODAA hassayite; Yerusalaamekka qoppite.

English Sentences: We are confounded, because we have heard reproach: shame hath covered our faces: for strangers are come into the sanctuaries of the LORD's house.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte, Nuuni cayettido gishshau kauyyida; allagati GODAA Beeta Maqidasiyan de7iya geeshsha sohota gelido gishshau, nuuni yeellaa maayida yaagideta.

English Sentences: Wherefore, behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will do judgment upon her graven images: and through all her land the wounded shall groan.
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin taani GODAI Baabiloone eeqata qaxxayiyo wodee yaana. Deshettidaageeti biitta ubban oolana.

English Sentences: Though Babylon should mount up to heaven, and though she should fortify the height of her strength, yet from me shall spoilers come unto her, saith the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baabiloonee saluwaa pude kiyidi, yan qatuwaa medhdhanau danddayiyaakkonne, yaa gakkanau kiyidi, a yan bashshiya asaa taani kiittana. Taani GODAI hagaa odais.

English Sentences: A sound of a cry cometh from Babylon, and great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Baabilooneppe asaa waasuwaa cenggurssai, Baabiloone biittaappe gita bashshaa kooshinchchai siyettana!

English Sentences: Because the LORD hath spoiled Babylon, and destroyed out of her the great voice; when her waves do roar like great waters, a noise of their voice is uttered:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, GODAI Baabiloone bashshana; a wolqqaama cenggurssaakka co77u oottana. Abbaa beetaadan guummiya morkketi woraajjiiddi garmmaamana.

English Sentences: Because the spoiler is come upon her, even upon Babylon, and her mighty men are taken, every one of their bows is broken: for the LORD God of recompences shall surely requite.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bashshiyaageeti Baabiloone bolli yaana; yin a olanchchati omoodettana; eta wonddafeekka meqqana. Taani GODAI haluwaa kessiya Xoossaa gidiyo gishshau, eta oosuwaadan taani etau zaarana.

English Sentences: And I will make drunk her princes, and her wise men, her captains, and her rulers, and her mighty men: and they shall sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the King, whose name is the LORD of hosts.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani a halaqata, a aadhdhida eranchchata, a deriyaa haariyaageeta, a ola gadaawatanne a olanchchata mattoyana; eti naa77antto denddennaadan, merinau xiskkana. Taani Kawoi, Ubbaappe Wolqqaama GODAA geetettiyaagee hagaa odais" yaagees.

English Sentences: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly broken, and her high gates shall be burned with fire; and the people shall labour in vain, and the folk in the fire, and they shall be weary.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaappe Wolqqaama GODAI hagaadan yaagees; "Orddiyan gimbbettida Baabiloone yuushuwaa gimbbee sa7an belettana; a adussa penggetikka taman xuugettana. Asai oottidobai ubbai hada; kawotettatikka tami maanabau coo daafuroosona" yaagees.

English Sentences: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah into Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And this Seraiah was a quiet prince.
Wolaitta Sentences: Mahiseeya na7aa Neeriyaa na7ai Saraayi Kawuwaa Sedeqiyaasassi oottiya halaqa. Sedeqiyaasi Yihudan kawotido oiddantto laitti, Saraayi aara Baabiloone biis. Biyo wode Ermmaasi Saraaya bolli kiitaa yeddiis.

English Sentences: So Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written against Babylon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baabiloone bollan gakkanau de7iya iitabaa ubbaanne Baabiloone xeelliya harabaa ubbaa Ermmaasi issi xaatta maxaafan xaafiis.

English Sentences: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When thou comest to Babylon, and shalt see, and shalt read all these words;
Wolaitta Sentences: Xaafidi Saraaya hagaadan yaagiis; "Neeni Baabiloone biittaa gakkido wode, ne qaalaa xoqqu oottada, asaassi ha maxaafaa nabbaba.

English Sentences: Then shalt thou say, O LORD, thou hast spoken against this place, to cut it off, that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi hagaadan yaagada woossa; Abeet GODAU, neeni, "Taani ha sohuwaa bashshana; ha sohuwan paxa qaaxxiya mereti, asikka, meheekka, do7ikka de7enna; ha sohoi merinau bazzo gidana" yaagadasa yaaga.

English Sentences: And it shall be, when thou hast made an end of reading this book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst of Euphrates:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha xaatta maxaafaa nabbabada wurssidoogaappe guyyiyan, shuchchaa he maxaafaara gatta qachchada, Efiraaxiisa SHaafan ola.

English Sentences: And thou shalt say, Thus shall Babylon sink, and shall not rise from the evil that I will bring upon her: and they shall be weary. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Olada, "Taani GODAI a bollan ehiyo iitaa gaasuwan, Baabilooneekka hagaadan naa77antto denddennaadan muukettana" yaagais yaaga" yaagiis. Ermmaasi haasayido qaalai hagan polettiis.

English Sentences: Zedekiah was one and twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hamutal the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sedeqiyaasi kawotiyo wode, laittai ayyo laatamanne isiino; Yerusalaamen i tammanne isiini laittaa kawotiis. A aayee sunttai Hamuxaalo; a Liibina kataman de7iya Ermmaasa na7iyo.

English Sentences: And he did that which was evil in the eyes of the LORD, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yo7aqeemi oottidoogaadan, Sedeqiyaasikka GODAA sinttan iitabaa oottiis.

English Sentences: For through the anger of the LORD it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah, till he had cast them out from his presence, that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Yerusalaame asaa bollinne Yihudaa asaa bolli hanqqettido gishshau, wurssettan eta ba sinttappe diggiis. Sedeqiyaasi Baabiloone kawuwaa bolli makkalidi denddiis.

English Sentences: And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon came, he and all his army, against Jerusalem, and pitched against it, and built forts against it round about.
Wolaitta Sentences: Denddin Sedeqiyaasi kawotido uddufuntta laitti, tammantta aginan, tammantta gallassi Baabiloone Kawoi Naabukadanaxoori ba olanchchata ubbaa ekkidi yiidi, Yerusalaame dooddiis. Eti a yuushuwankka biittaa keelaa diddiqidosona.

English Sentences: So the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sedeqiyaasi kawotido tammanne isiinintta laittaa gakkanaassi, Yerusalaame katamai doodettidi gam77iis.

English Sentences: And in the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the famine was sore in the city, so that there was no bread for the people of the land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gaasuwan biittan koshai suullin, he laitti oiddantto aginan, uddufuntta gallassan, he biittaa asaayyo miyoobi xayiis.

English Sentences: Then the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled, and went forth out of the city by night by the way of the gate between the two walls, which was by the king's garden; (now the Chaldeans were by the city round about:) and they went by the way of the plain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanidaashin katamaa yuushuwaa gimbbee issi baggaara qolettiis. Qolettin Baabiloone asai katamaa yuuyi aadhdhidi naagikkokka, Yihudaa kawuwaa olanchchati mule ubbai qammi kawo ataakilttiyaa sohuwaa efiya ogiyaa oiqqidi, naa77u dirssaa gimbbeta issippe gattiya penggiyaara kiyidi baqatidosona. Eti Yorddaanoosa Dilbbaakko simmidi biidosona.

English Sentences: But the army of the Chaldeans pursued after the king, and overtook Zedekiah in the plains of Jericho; and all his army was scattered from him.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Baabiloone olanchchati Kawuwaa Sedeqiyaasa yedettidi, Yarkko dembbaa gattiiddi oiqqidosona. Oiqqin a olanchchati ubbai appe shaahettidi laalettidosona.

English Sentences: Then they took the king, and carried him up unto the king of Babylon to Riblah in the land of Hamath; where he gave judgment upon him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, eti a Hamaata biittan, Ribila kataman de7iya Baabiloone kawuwaakko efiidosona. Efin yan Naabukadanaxoori Sedeqiyaasa bolli pirddiis.

English Sentences: And the king of Babylon slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes: he slew also all the princes of Judah in Riblah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi Sedeqiyaasa naata Sedeqiyaasi xeellishin, Baabiloone kawoi woriis. Yihudaa halaqata ubbaakka eti yan Ribila kataman woridosona.

English Sentences: Then he put out the eyes of Zedekiah; and the king of Babylon bound him in chains, and carried him to Babylon, and put him in prison till the day of his death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Sedeqiyaasa aifeta wooci kessidi, sanssalatan a qachchidi, Baabiloone biittaa ekkidi efiidosona. Efiidi i haiqqana gakkanaashin, yan qasho keettan a wottidosona.

English Sentences: Now in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was the nineteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, which served the king of Babylon, into Jerusalem,
Wolaitta Sentences: Naabukadanaxoori Baabiloonen kawotido tammanne uddufuntta laittan, ichchashantto aginan, tammantto gallassan, kawuwaa oosanchchatuppe issoi, kawuwaa naagiyaageetu halaqai Naabuzaraadaani Yerusalaame geliis.

English Sentences: And burned the house of the LORD, and the king's house; and all the houses of Jerusalem, and all the houses of the great men, burned he with fire:
Wolaitta Sentences: Gelidi GODAA Beeta Maqidasiyaa, kawo keettaanne Yerusalaamen de7iya keettata ubbaa taman xuuggiis; gita keetta giyo keetta ubbaa xuuggiis.

English Sentences: And all the army of the Chaldeans, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down all the walls of Jerusalem round about.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baabiloone olanchchati ubbai kawuwaa naagiyaageetu halaqaa azazuwan, Yerusalaame katamaa yuushuwan de7iya dirssaa gimbbiyaa ubbaa qolidosona.

English Sentences: Then Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive certain of the poor of the people, and the residue of the people that remained in the city, and those that fell away, that fell to the king of Babylon, and the rest of the multitude.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naabuzaraadaani wurssetta hiyyeesata, kataman attida asatanne kaddidi Baabiloone olanchchatun gaittida asata kushe hiillaa eriya asatuurakka gujjidi, omooduwau efiis.

English Sentences: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left certain of the poor of the land for vinedressers and for husbandmen.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Naabuzaraadaani wurssetta hiyyeesatuppe amaridaageeta woiniyaa turaa tokkanaadaaninne gadiyaa goyanaadan, Yihudan ashshiis.

English Sentences: Also the pillars of brass that were in the house of the LORD, and the bases, and the brasen sea that was in the house of the LORD, the Chaldeans brake, and carried all the brass of them to Babylon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baabiloone asati GODAA Beeta Maqidasiyan de7iya nahaasiyaappe medhdhido tuussata, miishshata wottiyo gaaretanne Abba Sainiyaa mentterettidosona; mentterettidi nahaasiyaa ubbaa Baabiloone efiidosona.

English Sentences: The caldrons also, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the bowls, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, qassi kereta, akaafata, xomppiyaa shaluwaa xeeraa pittiyoobata, kuixaarota, ixaanaa sainetanne yarshshiyo wode go7ettiyo nahaase miishshata ubbaa ekki efiidosona.

English Sentences: And the basons, and the firepans, and the bowls, and the caldrons, and the candlesticks, and the spoons, and the cups; that which was of gold in gold, and that which was of silver in silver, took the captain of the guard away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa naagiyaageetu halaqai Naabuzaraadaani qassikka worqqaappenne biraappe oosettida distteta, tamaa ekkiyo miishshata, kuixaarota, kereta, xomppiyaa wottiyo ballata, ixaanaa sainetanne ushshaa yarshshuwaassi go7ettiyo otota ekkidi biis.

English Sentences: The two pillars, one sea, and twelve brasen bulls that were under the bases, which king Solomon had made in the house of the LORD: the brass of all these vessels was without weight.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawoi Solomoni GODAA Beeta Maqidasiyan oosettiyaabatussi medhdhido naa77u tuussati, Abba Sainee, appe garssaara de7iya tammanne naa77u kormmatu misiletinne miishshata wottiyo gaareti merettido nahaase biratati meezaanan likkanau danddayettennaagaa keena daro.

English Sentences: And concerning the pillars, the height of one pillar was eighteen cubits; and a fillet of twelve cubits did compass it; and the thickness thereof was four fingers: it was hollow.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u tuussatikka issi mala gididi, issoi issoi tammanne hosppun wara adussa. Eta xeessaa yuushoi tammanne naa77u wara. Etau giddoi kofa gididi, biratai oiddu biradhdhe keenaa ordde.

English Sentences: And a chapiter of brass was upon it; and the height of one chapiter was five cubits, with network and pomegranates upon the chapiters round about, all of brass. The second pillar also and the pomegranates were like unto these.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa77u tuussatu huuphiyankka nahaasiyaappe oosettida gumbboti de7oosona. Issi gumbbuwaa geesai ichchashu wara gididi, yuushoi gitiyaa misiliyaaninne roomaaniyaa teeraa misiliyan alleeqetti uttiis. Naa77antto gumbboikka a mala.

English Sentences: And there were ninety and six pomegranates on a side; and all the pomegranates upon the network were an hundred round about.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gumbbotussi miyyiyan miyyiyan de7iya roomaanetu misileti uddufun tammanne hosppuna; yuushuwan de7iya gite milatiya misiletuppe bolla baggaara de7iya roomaane misileti muleera issi xeeta.

English Sentences: And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawuwaa naagiyaageetu halaqai Naabuzaraadaani qeese ubbatu halaqaa Saraaya, appe kaalliya qeesiyaa Xafaaniyaanne penggiyaa naagiya hara heezzu asata oiqqiis.

English Sentences: He took also out of the city an eunuch, which had the charge of the men of war; and seven men of them that were near the king's person, which were found in the city; and the principal scribe of the host, who mustered the people of the land; and threescore men of the people of the land, that were found in the midst of the city.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi he wode gakkanaashin, kataman de7iya asaappe ola gadaawaa, kawuwaa zoriyaageetuppe laappun asata efiis. Ola gadaawaa xaafiyaa, hegeenne olanchchata asaa giddoppe qoridi kessiyaagaanne hara usuppun tammu gita asata efiis.

English Sentences: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.
Wolaitta Sentences: Halaqai Naabuzaraadaani eta ubbaa ekkidi, Baabiloone kawuwaakko, Ribila katamaa efiis.

English Sentences: And the king of Babylon smote them, and put them to death in Riblah in the land of Hamath. Thus Judah was carried away captive out of his own land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yan Ribila kataman, Hamaata biittan Baabiloone kawoi eta ubbaa worissiis. Hegaadan hanidi, Yihudaa asai ba biittaappe denddidi, omooduwau biis.

English Sentences: This is the people whom Nebuchadrezzar carried away captive: in the seventh year three thousand Jews and three and twenty:
Wolaitta Sentences: Naabukadanaxoori kawotido laappuntta laittan heezzu sha7anne laatamanne heezzu asaa Yihudaappe omooddiis.

English Sentences: In the eighteenth year of Nebuchadrezzar he carried away captive from Jerusalem eight hundred thirty and two persons:
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi tammanne hosppuntta laittan hosppun xeetanne hasttamanne naa77u asaa Yerusalaameppe omooddiis.

English Sentences: In the three and twentieth year of Nebuchadrezzar Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty and five persons: all the persons were four thousand and six hundred.
Wolaitta Sentences: Naabukadanaxoori kawotido laatamanne heezzantto laittan kawuwaa naagiyaageetu halaqai Naabuzaraadaani laappun xeetanne oitamanne ichchashu asaa omooddiis. Omoodettida asaa qoodai muleera oiddu sha7anne usuppun xeeta.

English Sentences: And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, in the five and twentieth day of the month, that Evilmerodach king of Babylon in the first year of his reign lifted up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah, and brought him forth out of prison,
Wolaitta Sentences: Ewiili-Marodaaki kawotido laitti Yihudaa kawuwaa Yo7aakiina bonchchidi, qashuwaappe birshshiis. Hegee hanidoogee Yo7aakiini omoodetti qashettidi biido hasttamanne laappuntta laitti, tammanne naa77antto aginan, laatamanne ichchashantto gallassaana.

English Sentences: And spake kindly unto him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon,
Wolaitta Sentences: Ewiili-Marodaaki Yo7aakiinaara mal77o qaalaa haasayidi, Baabiloonen omooduwan de7iya hara kawotu ubbaappe aattidi, a bonchchiis.

English Sentences: And changed his prison garments: and he did continually eat bread before him all the days of his life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, Yo7aakiini qasho keettan maayido maayuwaa laammiis. Laammidi i attida ba de7o laitta ubban kawo maaddaappe miis.

English Sentences: And for his diet, there was a continual diet given him of the king of Babylon, every day a portion until the day of his death, all the days of his life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yo7aakiini haiqqana gakkanaashin, hachchi hachchi ayyo koshshiyaabaa ubbaa Baabiloone kawoi immiis.
